pages.text: These crops suck, but that doesn't mean they are useless. By setting up a mirror that faces a farmland plot, one can plant/harvest vampire crops by clicking on the Mirror. They will only reveal themselves through the Mirror's reflection, and will only grow during a new moon.

pages.name: Succo Crop
pages.text: Flip the page to see the recipe for these seeds.
A curious mirror. One that shows the world and everything in it, except the player. Perhaps this mirror can be used to reveal the true appearance of a certain vampiric crop?

A drop from the Succo crops. Rightclicking any non-player and non-boss mob with it will bind them to it. The bound item can then be added to a goblet, so that any damage you take will be redirected to that mob. The goblet will empty itself when the mob dies, or the block is broken.
Every dabbling vampire needs a goblet to drink their blood from, and this goblet is no different. Either clicking or throwing a (tagged) Vampiric Ointment at the cup will fill it up with blood.
